testcase.name: Slider > WHEN I use a desktop screenreader (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver) > AND I use the tab key to move focus to a range slider > I HEAR Its purpose is clear
Slider > WHEN I use a desktop screenreader (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver) > AND I use the tab key to move focus to a range slider > I HEAR It identifies itself as a range
Slider > WHEN I use a desktop screenreader (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver) > AND I use the tab key to move focus to a range slider > I HEAR Its label is read with the input
Slider > WHEN I use a desktop screenreader (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver) > AND I use the tab key to move focus to a range slider > I HEAR Its current value
Slider > WHEN I use a desktop screenreader (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver) > AND I use the tab key to move focus to a range slider > WHEN I use the left arrow keys I HEAR the value is changed one step
Slider > WHEN I use a desktop screenreader (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver) > AND I use the tab key to move focus to a range slider > WHEN I use the right arrow keys I HEAR the value is changed one step
TabList > WHEN I use a desktop screenreader (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver) > AND I use the tab key to move focus to a tab > I HEAR Its label and purpose is clear
TabList > WHEN I use a desktop screenreader (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver) > AND I use the tab key to move focus to a tab > I HEAR It identifies itself as a tab
TabList > WHEN I use a desktop screenreader (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver) > AND I use the tab key to move focus to a tab > I HEAR It expresses its state (selected/pressed/checked)
TabList > WHEN I use a desktop screenreader (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver) > AND I use the tab key to move focus to a tab > THEN when I use the tab key > I HEAR focus moves to the activated tab panel

TabList > WHEN I use a desktop screenreader (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver) > AND I use the tab key to move focus to a tab > IF TAB ACTIVATION IS AUTOMATIC > when I use the left/right arrow keys > I HEAR the tab is activated
